snippet: Best Buy, struggling to deal with competition from Amazon.com and turmoil in its leadership, might have avoided some of its problems by planning for the departure of its chief executive.
abstract: Floyd Norris, High & Low Finance column, opines that Best Buy's board, struggling to deal with competition from Amazon.com and turmoil in its leadership, might have avoided some of its problems by planning for the departure of chief executive Brian J Dunn; holds its failure to do so has left the company in a very bad situation, as the search for a permanent CEO goes on.
lead_paragraph: Best Buy, struggling to deal with competition from Amazon.com and turmoil in its leadership, might have avoided some of its problems by planning for the departure of its chief executive.

headline.print_headline: Best Buy Suffers For Lack Of a Plan
headline.seo: Best Buy Suffers for Lack of a Succession Plan
headline.main: Best Buy Suffers for Lack of a Plan
